channel.title: Should the All/Any rolelist remain?
channel.description:
I am curious if and when a role list game mode will be added to the game.
The role list unequivocally assists the Town (Blue Dragon) as it lets them narrow down claims that may be impossible giving them a natural edge. Evils must work much harder to develop a stable claim and avoid suspicion.
Of course, the natural progression of the role list funnels down to the scenario of "hang one, execute the other". Even with a fully believable claim, Blue Dragon may still have the resources to eliminate an Evil role that did a great job of deceiving others. A 3 player kingmaking dilemma still allows a 50/50 chance of a Blue Dragon win if one is confirmed and the remaining two players are virtually identical levels of trustworthiness.
I personally really enjoy the All/Any gamemode. Maybe because it requires me to think more, or maybe it's because I like seeing Evil roles actually win instead of getting steamrolled like they do in Town of Salem.
I would be surprised if devs never introduced the role list, but I wonder if ranked games will be a thing, and if they are would they be based on an All/Any set-up or with a standardized list?
I would love to see two ranked modes: All/Any and Rolelist.
All/Any could lead to ridiculous blowouts between teams. You'll have games where only one Blue Dragon spawns and everyone else is neutral and evil. But the allure of infinite claim space for evils in a ranked mode sounds so much more fair and fun for evils that I am personally willing to laugh off ridiculous games where it is so stacked against me.
The rule of Law of Large Numbers also promises that if you play enough games, the odds of you getting an average amount of games that ARE fair increases.
My question is- what would a fair role list look like?

item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
The way the math should be is you get points for actions done to help your current faction.

If, as knight, you CS a seeker and then are converted and find a neutral or something, you get the points for both actions

item.title: Should the All/Any rolelist remain?
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
The current class-list seems to be:

  • King
  • Prince
  • MM/CL
  • Assassin/Random Cult (not Apostle)
  • Random Neutral
  • Random Neutral
  • Random BD/Neutral
  • Random BD/Neutral
  • Random BD X8

Read full topic

item.title: Should the All/Any rolelist remain?
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
You need to remember that a player who is being very helpful is also less likely to be suspected unseen and is more likely to protected by CW. This means that helping BD will STILL help you win even if you are converted. Some of my best games were of me doing just that and winning anyway. If you are converted while the unseen/cult are loosing then it is never too late for you to win. If you are converted it means both of 2 things.

A: The MM/CL is still alive

B: There is at least 2 Unseen/Cult including you

This is enough to win a game of ToL even if you had outed the MM night night before and are coming into D4. I know because I have done this myself.

The only way that this can truly screw you over is if the sheriff scouted you. All you have to do to prevent this is point out that the sheriff scouted you (even if he didn’t) and then the MM will not convert you because it would be pointless compared to converting the sheriff itself or something.

Read full topic

item.description:
It needs to take into account your chances of winning from conversion

Personally act like a douche in game and I’ll convert you for the lose.

item.title: Should the All/Any rolelist remain?
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
I think maybe something like your performance as BD should be ranked separately from your performance as Unseen/Cult. As in, you are considered ‘killed’ when converted, and it is a separate game for you when you are converted

Read full topic

item.title: Should the All/Any rolelist remain?
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
No, bevause in those cases acting to further your faction doesn’t harm your end goal.

In a conversion-based game, playing well may directly harm your chances of winning later on. It’s as if all of the rules of the game are changed on the fly.

Read full topic

item.title: Should the All/Any rolelist remain?
item.dc:creator: í42-Xblade
item.description:
orangeandblack5:

Like you can be the best BD player in the whole game, get converted in a last-ditch effort, and then lose the game you single-handedly won

Welcome to ANY ranked game that’s not 1v1! Do awesome the entire game, then 1 person on your team goes AFK the last round. Do epic the entire game, then your partner just charges in Leeroy Jenkins style. It’s not that different: Technically, any game with ranked that isn’t 1v1 is broken to begin with.

But yea, we’ll think of something. Math ftw!

Read full topic

item.title: Should the All/Any rolelist remain?
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
You pretty much hit the nail on the head. It’s a near impossible issue to solve, if not completely so - otherwise conversion wouldn’t be a near-universally hated mechanic amongst skilled Mafia players.

Read full topic

item.title: Should the All/Any rolelist remain?
item.dc:creator: Sketch
item.description:
I hadn’t thought about how conversion could really mess up “true” wins and losses.

An excellent player could be completely killing it as BD only to set themselves up for demise later when they get converted last minute…

Would optimal play involve a plan that involves your own potential conversion? That feels like it might encourage gamethrowing scenarios where you do not help your own team to the best of your ability.

Tricky. Yeah, I have no clue.

Read full topic

item.title: Should the All/Any rolelist remain?
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
What

How

It’s literally impossible to make a sound elo system in a game where your side can be stolen part way through a match

Like you can be the best BD player in the whole game, get converted in a last-ditch effort, and then lose the game you single-handedly won

It’s a bad idea and it’s not worth attempting, in any capacity. Conversion mechanics are essentially anti-skill-based features, and trying to rank players based on skill in such a mode will not work out well. Maybe if Ranked has conversion disabled it would work, but at that point you’re making some major changes for the sake of a mode that isn’t all that special to begin with.

Read full topic

item.title: Should the All/Any rolelist remain?
item.dc:creator: í42-Xblade
item.description:
1. There will not be a role class list. This is boring and bloats the UI~

  2. There will be different game modes/types. Probably sooner than you think.

  3. There will be ranked.

Ranked in a conversion game is a BAD IDEA.

This is personal opinion We say it’s a great idea, as long as it curves based on ELO

Read full topic
